Gl-wlyn-g4MY0COmBREOew.text: Went again today at lunch - and was surprised by their prixe fixe lunch menu. For $18 you can get 3 courses which are HUGE and filling. Added bonus: almost always no wait at lunch.   This spot has one of the best outdoor patios in town that will make you want to take a 2 hour lunch. The rose sangria is crave-ably good. Park in the parking deck by the mall and walk over, don't even bother trying to park out front.

1DLt6U_z8Tow4pfexZl8wA.text: Yummy food and friendly staff. Came here for dinner/happy hour with a friend at the bar and enjoyed the happy hour drink specials and menu. Definitely recommend the garlic shrimp! The queso looked like the top of lasagna and was delicious. The bartenders took good care of us and we definitely enjoyed ourselves with them cracking jokes and being silly. Great spot to try several dishes and share with friends/family.

4AP9Kv-Z0Oh3NdL8ywOjaA.text: The brunch menu at Bulla's is not like any other in Charlotte. The Spanish inspired recipes add a spicy kick and unexpected texture to the most important meal of the day. I really appreciated and enjoyed slurping the garbanzo frito this chilly afternoon; it's a warm stew like dish topped off with a poached egg. For a more familiar breakfast staple, order the revuelto lucio, a perfectly seasoned scramble with lots of shrimp and oyster mushrooms.

photos.caption: Photo of Bulla Gastrobar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunch menu

zd4kwMClbKipgnqKna_KyQ.text: I had never even heard of this place before. I was originally going to The Cowfish for dinner, but after hearing there was an almost 2 hour wait I had to scramble to find something else. Then there it was, a restaurant right next door with no wait. My family got a table right away, close to the kitchen. The atmosphere was very intimate and cozy with low lighting. I would definitely say this is more upscale than The Cowfish, but not so upscale jackets are required. Our waiter was extremely nice and did an amazing job of explaining all of the Spanish food I was unfamiliar with. We decided to do a mix of small plates and a large entree so we wouldn't leave hungry.  We started with the meat and cheese board which was fantastic. The cheese was a little strong for my taste, but the chutney balanced out the flavors and I fell in love with it. The olives had pits in them, but they were delicious so it didn't stop me. We also ordered the montaditos and pan con tomate which were fantastic as well. The chicken skewers were also something we split, and were gone quickly. The garlic shrimp my dad ordered was a nice little surprise, and the bread was delicious dipped in the flavored oil the shrimp had been cooked in.  While we had so many small plates to sample on, I wanted to get a large plate to finish. I went with the churrasco which was absolutely fantastic. The cheese grits were a perfect pairing with the skirt steak and sauteed vegetables. I could barely finish it, but it was worth it.  While this place is definitely more expensive than the Cowfish right beside it, the experience, atmosphere, and food is definitely worth the price. I would suggest Bulla for a nice date or something special to celebrate. I look forward to visiting again in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Bulla Gastrobar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Churrasco
Photo of Bulla Gastrobar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Salmon
Photo of Bulla Gastrobar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bistro Steak

vNYrOtCD6kKDY4lCQ5SX2Q.text: Went there on father's day, Sunday evening. Read alot of great reviews so decided to give a shot. Overall not bad.  The place is nice inside, center stage bar, comfortable booths. Beautiful patio section. Food was to die for, incredibly delicious and great presentation. A good wine selection and obviously a well stocked bar from jack to blue label. My two complaints are service and price. Now the price I understand you go in to expecting to be high, but for the portions you got here it's a little ridiculous. Service  was ok, we had the bartender as our waitress so that could of been some of the issue. But overall the if you are in Charlotte  you must come here.

KkAoW7-Wzoq4hJyY4ewI7w.text: I had the most incredible first experience at Bulla! And for those that are having a little bit of a hard time saying it correctly... it's BOO-YA! I love it !  I enjoyed lunch with two friends from work and also received a tour of the space for future events. The manager Richard was such a joy and really took his time explaining the details of the venue. He also shared insight about Bulla and its history as well as the history of the Charlotte location.  When walking inside the decor really caught my eye. The mixture of color, texture, shapes, and sizes worked really well together, and the bright yellow and blue reflected well with the sun that day.  As the weather starts to warm here in the QC, I can wait to enjoy lunch and cocktails on the huge patio! He also shared they would host Paella Day here for what he's hoping to be 500 guests! So this should be an enjoyable place and certainly a must on my summer cocktails and appetizers list!

-lijuX8DsjZdca6mKnOTGQ.text: Came for the food, left with a great experience!  Bulla was the perfect spot for a girls night out. I came on a Saturday night with 3 of my girlfriends. We stalked the menu and looked at photos before hand because we are millennials, duh   We had a hard time deciding to split a bottle of wine or a pitcher of sangria, but after much deliberation we went with a bottle of Sauvignon Blanc. The wine was fine. We were expecting our waiter to do the traditional pour a bit in a glass, and one person sips and accepts for the table, but this didn't happen. No big deal though.   We each ordered two tapas. We enjoyed the garlic shrimp which came with bread but the oil I assume you were supposed to dip  the bread in, didn't have much flavor.   The shrimp were great and the ends were already off so you could enjoy without Having to do much work.   We compared Bulla to Barcelona, as their menus are similar.  Bulla impressed us more food wise, but compared to Barcelona, we found the wine and the asthetics to be a bit more pleasing.

mDs0Cx76jRPVurgbTHvYFg.text: I'm in Charlotte on a little vacay, so I've been getting my restaurant recommendations from Yelp and from friends. When trying to decide today's late lunch/early dinner (or, as I like to jokingly call it, "dunch"), I came across the great Yelp reviews for Bulla Gastrobar.  I've been to Spain (and I've been to Tapas bars in Cali), so I was excited to try this out! It's very close to my hotel. However, I could not for the life of me figure out how to get to it! This is truly due to my being an out-of-towner! I ended up parking at the Crate & Barrel and walking over to the restaurant.  It was nearly 3pm when I arrived, so it wasn't too busy. Today happens to be National Paella Day, so the staff was preparing a little for the evening's shenanigans. I may have to sneak back over there tonight and try their Paella and Sangria!  I ordered from the Prix Fixe lunch menu and it was delish! I ordered the Spinach Salad and Bulla Burger, as well as a glass of 2016 vintage Emilio Moro Ribera del Duero. I don't think there was a single piece of spinach on my salad, however it was delicious nonetheless! I had my burger cooked to the chef's liking (I almost always choose to have things cooked the way the chef would like them prepared). My burger came with a side of patatas bravas.  I. Ate. Everything. Every last little bite! I don't think I'll ever have to eat again! I was completely stuffed! It was so good though, that I could waste a morsel! I'll definitely be back and I even recommended the restaurant to my ex-husband!

wK43MRiaE7tJQKcMUOKrfw.text: A group of four of us checked out Bulla Gastrobar this past Saturday. Absolutely delish meal!   We started off with drinks. I noticed they had a few different types of Sangria. I got the red sangria and it was very tasty and not too sweet. Later on I got that Bullfighter, which was a nice mix of flavors. Another in our group got the Boujie Palmer....super fun to say and very good!  Throughout the night, we had alot of tapas. I thought the tapas were priced and portioned very nicely: -Lomo Iberico- nicely sliced pork! -Patatas bravas- The sauce on the potatoes was soooo delish! -Canneloni- Crowd winner at the table! Definitely had a strong truffle oil flavor but no complaints here! -Gambas al Ajillo- Very large shrimp in garlic and butter. Simple and done nicely. -Albondigas- These meatballs were a perfect mixture of veal, pork, and cheese -Montaditos- Brisket on pieces of bread. Another crowd winner! -Tartar de Atun- Amazing flavors!!! One of my personal faves! -Croquettas de Jamon- Nicely portion but not one of my favorites of the night  Definitely want to go back to get the paella! Service was fantastic! Win all the round!

4yjtWcqegSOXbrhIV5teSw.text: Bulla is a newer restaurant to Charlotte and I have been here quite a bit. There were things I liked and things I didn't. It was a love hate relationship between us. I went back this last time and had an overall good experience which brings me to settle on the four stars.   The new management seem to care a lot about their customers. There were some one it first opened that didn't share the same sentiment. I'm glad they found people who do. Some of the servers that were originally there have been replaced. Some are still there from the beginning.   I found what I like on the menu and like to stick to it. Fortunately those items have remained consistent. I love the burger, pan con tomate, and tuna.   I hope that this place is here to stay & just continues to be good. When I went on a Friday night LAST time w/ reservations at 7PM, I had no wait. I think they may have got the wait situation down and under control. Fingers crossed!

9KXqJ9yY2rMWv1nB-UgHtA.text: I love, love, love spanish cuisine, and tapas are a huge reason why. If it's your first time here, you'll get a quick rundown by the server on how it works. Basically, you share smaller-sized plates (these weren't very small, imo) with the whole table, and food comes out as soon as it's ready.   Our server, I believe his name was Jose, was super awesome. We got there at 6:45, and weren't seated at the bar, but were still given happy hour menus when we inquired about them. I highly recommend going during happy hour, 5-7 everyday, if possible. There are meat and cheese boards as well as a decent selection of their tapas from the main menu that are discounted. Otherwise, it's kinda pricey.   Food: The 2 of us were hungry so we split 5 tapas. It was enough to fill us up comfortably. I would suggest ordering one or more of the larger plates if coming with a bigger group.  - sauteed garlic shrimp: about 6 shrimp sauteed in a generous amount of butter and garlic. They came with a side of delicious, warm baguette.  - pimientos de padron: A simple dish, but tasty. I've never had blistered shishito peppers before. They have a wonderful smokey roasted flavor and sort of just dissolve in your mouth.  - patatas bravas: fried potato cubes smothered in a supposedly spicy but decidedly bland garlic aioli. It looked a lot better than it tasted. It didn't taste bad; the aioli added a nice creamy texture. My dining companion said this was her favorite, but I wouldn't necessarily recommend it unless you really love potatoes.   - kale salad: my personal favorite dish of the night and among the most memorable kale salads I've had (even though it comes with beets, which I despise). The kale is topped with barley and goat cheese, and tossed with a delightful lemon maple dressing. Not recommended for people who don't like sweeter dressings.  - albondigas: 3 veal and pork meatballs topped with finely shredded manchego and sitting atop a savory and flavorful tomato sauce.   Cocktail: I came on a day where they had select cocktails for $7. I got the lemongrass collins, an herby and refreshing drink, though not very alcoholic.  Ambience: it's southpark, so it was classy and well-decorated. The vibe is pretty laid-back.  Overall, Bulla isn't quite the same caliber as places I've been to in Europe, but for Charlotte, it's pretty darn good.

1-SN8A9Pv7qkpCurEN3vxg.text: As big fans of Spanish cuisine, Bulla was a pleasant surprise to stumble upon while in the area. We were visiting Charlotte and had our dog with us, so it was nice to find a shaded, dog-friendly patio to pass the time on a warm day.  All of the staff we encountered were incredibly friendly and outgoing. The bartender even came over to show us photos of his two chihuahuas and talk about dogs for a few minutes after seeing our little one! The atmosphere was cavernous, but inviting. It was during that weird time between lunch and dinner, so the mostly-empty space seemed massive inside, but the patio was gorgeous. Tons of shaded seating, and enough greenery between the restaurant and the road to make it a relaxing environment to enjoy a meal.  The menu has a lot of traditional Spanish dishes, which was nice to see. Their pan con tomate was a little heavy on the tomato topping, resembling an Italian bruschetta more than the lightly-covered version we're used to when we're in Spain, but the flavor was wonderful. Their patatas bravas were some of the best we've had in recent memory! Perfectly-cooked potatoes. Crispy enough on the outside to not become soggy under the weight of the bravas sauce and aioli, but still tender inside. Their bravas sauce had the perfect balance of smokiness and spiciness. Just great, honestly, and we've eaten countless bravas in Spain to back up our praise! Ha! The gazpacho was especially refreshing on the hottest day of the year, as well. We finished our meal with their paella. It was probably too much food for two people, but we were just in the mood for it, so we dove in! It was worth it, too. Our only wish was that they had let the paella cook a bit longer to get a better socarrat, which is one of the best elements of a good paella. We may request that if we can the next time we visit.  Overall, we had a wonderful experience. The food was excellent, the service was attentive and friendly, the environment was inviting, and the menu was full of our favorites. If you can't get to Spain, Bulla is certainly a suitable replacement until you can!

It is a very good place for that sort of eating. The paella was great! Nice smoky flavor, we had the chicken. Everything we tried was good. I did not try the sangria, but the others really liked it- hence why there was none left for a sample I guess!  service was ok. My water glass went dry for a long time. A personal pet peeve. Atmosphere is nice. Noisy but not too bad for a Friday night.

My server Tashima is a keeper she gave  recommendations that were on point and very attentive and sweet.  The Managers even took the time to stop by my table and make sure everything was going well.  I recommend this place for everyone! From the food to the prices, service and atmosphere definitely a added delight to Charlotte!!

nTPjbZzsWxvBEZ_OmR9ibQ.text: Forgettable meal and experience  To start the toasted tomato bread was soggy, cheese plate (well you can't easily  mess up cheese) was fine, shrimp and ahituna were tasty.  Paella was way too salty and clams were gritty so the kitchen didn't clean them well but the shrimp, prawns, and calamari were properly cooked but the saltiness of the paella was too overpowering so the dish fell flat.   The churrasco was good but not even close to medium rare more towards medium well.   Waiter was acceptable but not very knowledgeable about ingredients.  He had no idea what clams were served in the various dishes and after asking the kitchen claimed they were little necks from the Caribbean ( little necks do not come from there).  We got no help or suggestions from the waiter on menu choices which would have been nice.  Atmosphere was fine but reminded me of a hotel restaurant.  Sorry, one and done at Bulla with better choices for Spanish tapas in town

nhoKKygaCi4BDxsb0JngJg.text: 3.5 stars. When we first heard Bulla was opening, we were so excited to have paella in Charlotte. It took us way too long to try it out; however, after tasting the paella, we weren't that upset that we didn't make it here sooner. While the rice had good flavor, there was no layer of crispy, caramelized rice on the bottom of the pan. If you've never had paella like this, you're definitely missing out.

1eDELPz3cifso4S_L_tNqA.text: Delicious food! I was a bit skeptical but everything I ordered was delicious. Incredible ceviche and gazpacho. The croquetas are different than what most people would be used to, I assume, but they are the Spanish style and tastes great. The decoration is beautiful. I don't think I'll ever get used to how tips work in the US, but today I was glad to tip my server well, Zachary. I'll be back for dinner and hope to have him as our server again.

VjPYMkedmv-klPOZrqXukA.text: Tonight was my first time here and needless to say I will not be back nor recommending it. Arrived around 5:15 to an almost empty restaurant; including the inside, outside, and bar area and was rudely told by the 3 hostesses that only the bar area was available because of their "upcoming reservations". Honestly ridiculous considering the amount of wait staff that was mindlessly wandering during our entire visit, due to their empty tables. Also disappointed with the menu to say the least, Not only is it very specific, but overpriced and simply not worth it. Ordered a "queso" which was in fact a $7 plate of two slices of goat cheese? The food menu is specific, but as is the drink menu. Disappointing to see an upcoming restaurant in a great location handle guest interactions and culinary experience so poorly.

QEhMlyfn9Cvi9OiWEfIDTA.text: Hope the manager and the staff read this. I will go to no other restaurant in the area that offers seafood than Bulla. Having lived on Cape Cod in New England; their quality of seafood, especially the calamari, is exactly what the seafood comes like from the Cape Cod Bay. It's not oversized. It's extremely high quality. It is not outrageously expressive. And the place is always packed because Charlotteans realized that Bulla is THE REAL DEAL. As a resident of the Residence of Southpark (the building above where Bulla resides; all of us are elated that Bulla opened up. It was about time such a high quality food restaurant opened up. 5/5 Stars? No way. 10/10 Stars. Have the calamari. It reminds me of when I lived on Cape Cod. YOU NEED TO START COMING TO BULLA.

The manager stopped by to say hello. The interactions the entire team had with each other were relaxed, funny, and positive - but we never waited for anything. It was a just a place full of great food and great vibes.

eoB-wrGcV7neunTCDNuvWg.text: Today was my third visit and it just keeps getting better! It was brunch but I was craving a kale salad and I sat at the bar because I intended to get my food to go but then the French toast starting calling my name (don't judge me lol) so I stayed in to eat that. I got my salad to go And also ordered the ensalada verde to go after hearing my waiter rave about it. Grant, my server was very attentive and keen to make sure you were satisfied and was just very friendly and welcoming in general. He gave very helpful suggestions too. Honestly the best server I have had period that I can remember in a long time. The French toast were to die for and with great service you just can't get any better than that.

jOVPZCh7XjYmI0Zi51ws9Q.text: As a native Spaniard I can say the flavors are the closest I have ever tried in Charlotte, great atmosphere, quality ingredients, excellent recipes and execution!

b0Ho9JHWADaZR4IIXFZh5g.text: I came in here with my wife the other day and everything was amazing. The food was excellent, our waitress Grace recommended several different tapas including the montaditos, which was our favorite. With this great service and incredible food will definitely come back!

dCCDcujvyZFCiXa2E3oCBw.text: I rarely give 5 stars but this place definitely deserves them based on this visit! My two friends and I showed up at 10am on a Sunday, expecting to eat brunch. Little did we know that they didn't open till 11am. That didn't stop the manager Kenny from ushering us to the bar where they opened and served us drinks before they were even ready for customers. Clint, the bartender, welcomed us with open arms and a bit of frazzle. He was undeniably friendly and made us feel like he'd never met a stranger. He was excited to tell us all about the place and give recommendations on their fantastic drinks. We stayed at the bar for brunch which turned out to be an excellent idea. We were able to chat for an hour before eating and then had a leisurely, inebriated brunch! All of our food was excellent. Fresh and creative. I can't wait to come back for tapas and drinks after work! The meat and cheese selections are all from Spain and nothing in their restaurant is ever frozen. It really feels like an authentic experience. I can't say enough good things about Kenny and Clint. They were everything that so many places lack. Friendly and accommodating even when it wasn't convenient for them. I could not be more impressed by a newly opened restaurant. Their outdoor space opens this fall and will add a whole additional layer to the romantic atmosphere. Can't wait to experience it!

1NekX9r6UdRlBBYon09GKA.text: We went for my birthday and my husband had put that in the reservation. No acknowledgement of my birthday which was disappointing.   I am Spanish and so I know this type of food. I was disappointed with the food. It didn't have a lot of taste. The croquetas didn't taste like jamon serrano. The albondigas were cold and dense with little flavor. The pan con tomate was wet and cold with little flavor.   The wine, patatas bravas and coconut flan plus passion fruit sorbet were good.  I would go again for wine and try the cheeses and charcuterie and just stick to those things.

55Gh4BhCh_5tHhystRbooA.text: Just last night, I enjoyed a Queen's Feast with a group of girls at this trendy, new hot spot.  As expected, the place was stylish..and even offered an intimate, romantic vibe.  Given that it was on a special three-course, Queen's Feast night, the place was packed...and it was quite loud.  Of course, our group sat at the high-top tables by the bar, so that probably made our area a bit louder than the rest of the restaurant. I yearned to sit at one of the "normal" low tables (as our high top was quite uncomfortable...and super-tight, near-claustrophic seating at that!), in the quieter areas of the restaurant, but then you have to make your sacrifices when you join a group outing.  Now the food!!  Since I read the raving reviews, I came expecting the best.  Possibly because of my high expectations, I felt a bit let down.  First of all, I expected a lengthier selection of tapas.  Again, I was expecting too much...especially given that I've been to several superb Spanish restaurants in my past, featuring truly impressive/massive selection of tapas. Still, I enjoyed my first small tapas plate - "Albondigas", 3 chunky veal and pork meatballs in heavy red sauce.  Then came my second small plate (which was actually closer to HUGE!) - "Braised Brisket Caldoso", which was basically a big plate of slow-cooked brisket mixed with Valencia-style rice in their special red sauce.  My only complaint here - and it's probably just a personal preference - is the over-abundance of meat to rice ratio!  I would have preferred more rice, less beef...but this plate was super-charged with brisket!  Still, it was quite good...but almost too much of it.  Again, HUGE portion...enough to feed 2-3 people!  (I had to bag half of it to go)  Then came the biggest disappointment...and it was a shared disappointment with all the girls in the group.  Their Spanish-style Creme Brulee, or "Creme Catalana" was just simply BAD.  The sugary frosting was weak, waaay too sweet, and the brulee was cold...and tasted closer to a cheap pudding than an actual brulee.  VERY disappointing!  Although I'm a shameless fan of desserts (*oink, oink*), I was only able to muster up for a few bites.  Now, trust me...that's shocking!  Honestly, I don't think a single girl in the table finished this dessert.  THIS is where I definitely had to take away a "Star".  Given that it was a bustling night, and we were a  big group, I think the service was reasonably good (although there was one mix-up with an order with one of the girls)...and we didn't have to wait too long for our plates or for our drinks.  Speaking of, their Sangrias were very strong (only took 1 glass to make me fully dazed and drunk!), but solid...to be expected at a Spanish gastropub.  All in all, this restaurant/pub is another great addition to the Charlotte foodie scene...and I thoroughly liked many aspects of this restaurant.  If only their desserts (others that tried the "Churros" didn't seem overwhelmed either) were better...and if only they had a few more exciting tapas on their menu (but then, I'm very greedy and spoiled)??  Still, I probably WILL return in the future... probably with my husband, for a quieter, more relaxed dining experience, with low-table seating...away from the bar!

YAAam3CnnT4xzGBnnRPJIw.text: Service + food + drinks = excellent experience.  We had the calamari, patatas bravas, montaditis, gambas, and croquetes for dinner. I'm not usually a sangria drinker but decided to give it a try and I'm glad I did the traditional red was outstanding.

FWdZ-k0n5Cq1cJnIZxaInA.text: Obsessed! This is our fourth time here and the food and sangria are always amazing. Tapas come out at the perfect time; just as we're finishing the last one. This place never disappoints.

La1EDdWTZfK1AQ9sK-Rd8w.text: As someone who's lived in Miami for a while, I can honestly say this is one of the best, most authentic tapas/pintxo spots Charlotte has to offer! Service was amazing and every dish was fresh, flavorful, and perfectly decadent. The Huevos Bulla and Verde Salad are must trys! One of Charlotte's best restaurants that was worth every penny.

djwyyT8y9W_ZfPOIiI6pyg.text: We stopped in at their around 3-week mark. Waitstaff was super nice and attentive. Receiving glasses of wine was very slow. I think this had more to do with wherever it was coming from than the waiter because he kept looking to see if the glasses were ready. Anyway, waitstaff seems a little green - like this may be their first job waiting tables for real. But they all tried and had great senses of humor and quick smiles. Decor was cool and hip - it is a fun place. Live music in the bar would give a better edge.  The food was just ok. I would do lunch here, but I wouldn't commit to a dinner - Charlotte has developed into quite the foodie city, so they're going to have to step up their game. Charlotte is also transient, so people have been around and know Spanish tapas and how good it can be.  Things we had:  1 cheese and 1 meat:  the cheese needs better presentation - it was as if I slapped some cheese on a plate for my kids. The crackers were nice, but not nearly enough of the jam to finish the plate. The meat we selected was really good - still boring presentation. I'm sure the preset platter was decked out better, but they shouldn't sacrifice presentation even if the order is smaller.  seafood paella: I thought it was too salty, my husband  didn't. the presentation was beautiful - the pan was missing that amazing crust around the edges that Spanish families love so much - my friends from Spain literally argue over who gets it and told me it's like the wishbone. At Bulla, nobody gets it bc it's not there. They did an amazing job not overcooking the shrimp and the shrimp didn't have that odd preservative aftertaste that cheap shrimp has, so that was a huge plus - the squid fell flat though. A little tasteless and rubbery.  ALBONDIGAS - the meatballs - they were cold and a little dry. But the flavor was really good. the sauce was really good. I told my husband it seemed like they were cooked earlier, chilled, and they had relied on the sauce to heat them back up. But it didn't work. I do this for my kids at home all the time, so I know the drill.   Ceviche -  I  can't complain. it was great. I'm not a big fan of shrimp ceviches and prefer other white fish, but it was really good with flavor.  Overall it was pretty good- but not at the level it can be. I do think the managers need to take field trips to some of the other Spanish tapas places to see what the people in Charlotte love. And maybe the amazing Curate in Asheville. I know I shouldn't compare Bulla to that place and my multiple friends from Spain when they cook at home - but Spanish food is pretty simple and to have it fall flat isn't necessary at all.  I would go back for drinks at the bar and a couple of tapas - but not a full dinner.  That said, they're just catching their stride and are pretty new on the Charlotte scene, so maybe I'd give them another shot.

Afui7CHJLKvdyUZqscB6zg.text: I really wanted to love Bulla but it was just ok. I had seen that it was opening so my husband and I stopped in on a Thursday night. We sat at a table in the bar area and were served quickly. I have to start by saying that it was pretty stuffy and humid in the restaurant. It's been hot so maybe they're working on getting the temperature right but it was a little uncomfortable.  We shared a pitcher of the red sangria. It was good, but not my favorite. It was a little too sweet and had a strange sugar aftertaste. For food we had the patatas bravas, gambas al ajillo, tortilla espanola, croquetas de jamon, the montaditos, and the paleta iberica. The potatoes were good, but nothing too special. They had a nice sauce and weren't too spicy. The gambas were disappointing. They didn't have much flavor except for some chili flakes and it felt like something I could make at home. The croquetas were also plain, and didn't have much ham. We did really enjoy the tortilla espanola, it was flavorful and was a generous portion. The paleta iberica was delicious, it melts in your mouth. However I'm not sure it's worth $15 for the small portion. The highlight of the meal was the montaditos, a short rib on bread dish. The meat was tender and flavorful and the tomato marmalade was delicious on top.   We didn't have a bad meal here, I was just underwhelmed by most of the dishes and drinks. I will say the service was fantastic from the host to our waitress. They made an effort to be over the top friendly, know our names, and be there when we needed but not hover too much.

wKuLGKUW5Jk1OSXSa4nrZQ.text: The kale salad is the best in town - the lemon maple dressing is to die for! I crave this every time I come - the soup was ok I didn't like that it was chilled but it's supposed to be, I just wanted to try something new :) definitely check this spot out everything else is amazing & the customer service is always on point!

lLlJtBIcNV2c769YTf6kSQ.text: Had a club Social at Bulla last night. Was blown away by the excellent food and service. Will definitely be back!

n9cNyNo_AABmSlJp2egS3Q.text: This place is delicious!  Everything we had was wonderful and the wine was perfectly paired for us by our server Zack. He made wonderful suggestions and we could not have had a more pleasant time at this restaurant.  But now this is what makes a delicious place stand out... we decided to walk back to our hotel, a few blocks away. About a block and a half away we hear someone running up to us. Zack, our server comes running up with our forgotten credit card. How amazing is that?  Some people just go above and beyond. Zack is one of those people.

1Eyl_YvMeOSQp-kojj5pUg.text: None of the four of us were familiar with the Spanish dishes we had to choose from. The dishes we chose where very well presented. The Pintxos skewers of Pork and Chicken were excellent. The Tartar de Atun, Ahi Tuna, was excellent. The Churrasco Moreno, melt in your mouth skirt steak was just that. Our server, Lorenzo, was very menu savvy and a great highlight of the evening.

M-T-p_4v4Fu2Gb4CWXCbxg.text: This was fabulous. Wonderful food and excellent service! Our table received the Potato Tortilla (a traditional Spanish omlette) by accident. Nobody in particular was to excited about it, however, once we had each tasted it, we nearly fought over who would finish it.  Reasonably priced for quality and service. Casual easy atmosphere. Fresh food and friendly knowledgable staff.

0RDq8nqjypRE0xiCCFiZPA.text: I can't believe the score on this place is so high. I love Spanish food and thought this place was mediocre at best. We got the paella which didn't have much flavor and NO CRUST at the bottom, which is kind of necessary if you're going to call it paella. The meet was also not great quality. Croquettes were very small and lacked flavor as well. B

3jCJsULVooyUCHZ2P0aUPw.text: Had lunch here with family. I have been to Spain & had tapas & I have to say this is the best I have had since. I love tortilla espanola - this was a little on the greasy side & somewhat overcooked. Other tapas ordered were salmon rillettes - my fav, albondigas/meatballs - loved the sauce, brussel sprout salad, spicy shrimp. I wish they had ensalada rusa - not on the menu. The white sangria was delicious too - not too sweet. Fruit was very fresh & lots of it. We shared an order of churros. Very good waiter, wish I could remember his name, he took very good care of us - party of 7. I will go back if I get to Charlotte.

1Hc7ftE2aPz6WEDKqzwQBg.text: Made a reservation for a Saturday night and was seated right away. Our server was very helpful and knowledgeable. We decided to try a bunch of the small plates and they were all delicious- I would recommend trying the ceviche and the montaditos.

RPzWbwed0XY__FYpt208Yw.text: Update 1. I went back and they have things in order, and the food is extraordinary. They also reached out and asked for feedback.

6FIgai-iIk0x6QrRRgH5MQ.text: Great Low key spot for family or significant other. Away from all the chaos in the mall but still in the area. Great selection menu. Highly recommended the chicken and waffles or Salmon burger. The avocado test is light and a great starter. The best experience is the service from Alexis. He explained the whole menu and extremely courteous.  I will come back, when traveling again.

lP71ycm5R4IXgg8rsyPlDA.text: We went for brunch, so maybe the experience is different when it's dinner but only 1 of the 3 dishes we ordered was tasty (the tuna tartare was on point.) With such great reviews we expected much better food and were sadly disappointed.
